meanings.definition: Having the power or authority to give advice or recommend
meanings.sent1: The friendly librarian provided an advisory suggestion on which book to read next.
meanings.sent2: It is important to seek advisory help from experienced professionals when making big decisions.
meanings.sent3: The wise owl gave an advisory tip to the young birds about the safest way to build a nest.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor and thoughtful words had an advisory effect on the anxious students.
meanings.sent5: The advisory note on the bulletin board reminded everyone to be kind and respectful.

meanings.definition: A formal warning or announcement, especially about potential dangers or risks.
meanings.sent1: The weather advisory alerted residents about the upcoming storm and advised them to stay indoors.
meanings.sent2: The travel advisory recommended avoiding certain areas due to political unrest.
meanings.sent3: The advisory from the lifeguard reminded swimmers to be cautious of strong currents.
meanings.sent4: The advisory from the health department urged people to get vaccinated to prevent the spread of disease.
meanings.sent5: The advisory broadcast on the radio warned drivers about icy road conditions ahead.
